sub_title: Key Account Manager at DB Schenker
summary: Experienced Key Account Manager with a demonstrated history of working in the logistics and supply chain industry. Skilled in Negotiation, Freight, Sales, Airports, and Sales Operations. Strong sales professional with a Bachelor of Business Administration (B.B.A.) focused in Commercial Economics from Amsterdam University of Applied Sciences.

projects.title: Georgia Tourism Summit '14 - Connecting and building strategic partnerships
projects.description:
In cooperation with two Georgian universities we conducted several market and cultural researches into the tourism industry, western European travelers and tourism possibilities in Georgia. During a three-day conference in Georgia Tbilisi we brought the Western European industry together with the Georgian industry. We informed both parties about the current tourism industry and what the future possibilities are. The consult that we gave to participants will affect their strategy, operational execution, marketing mix and marketing communication. 

Responsibilities: Sales, Marketing and Organization 

Main objective: Bring the western European industry together with the Georgian industry to improve the tourism growth. 

Book Publication: Georgia Tourism Summit ‘ 14 – Connecting and building strategic relationships 

Internet Publications: 
http://tavisupali.ge/siakhleebi/1779-turizmis-samiti-shavi-zghvis-saerthashoriso-universitetshi.html?lang=ka-GE 

http://newsday.ge/index.php?newsid=6685

projects.title: Minor - European Business Skills (EBS)
projects.description:
EBS (European Business Skills) is an elective course (so-called minor) of 30 study credits. 
There are a few reasons why HvA offers this course: 
- allowing the part-time student to experience short-stay intensive international mobility
- to make it possible to speed up study programmes, by making better use of the non-lesson periods within the academic year. The modules we presently can offer are:

- Summer school: cross-cultural country knowledge of all European Union member states. Always organised in a Southern-European country towards the end of June. Duration: two weeks abroad, predeparture assignments at home
- Market research for Dutch Embassy. Depending on the prefered market and availability of adequate students and project funding, we opt for one or two Embassies per semester
- Winter school: communication skills, from a Euro-Asian perspective. 
Location: always organised in an Asian location in February. Our partner school is in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. Duration: two weeks abroad, predeparture assignments at home.

We afterwards plan to add a distance learning module as well (in English), on European Leadership.

projects.title: Flourishing Trade Poland / Holland 2014
projects.description:
During the project a market research has been conducted into the Polish cut flower and flower bulb market. There has been a large field research into the B2B market and into the Polish customers to receive consumer insights. Alongside a cultural market scan was developed to show cultural difference between Dutch and Polish traders and consumers. In February 2014 a seminar was organized at the Dutch Embassy in Warsaw were we presented the participants the key findings of the research and a booklet. During this seminar we provided participants marketing and strategic advise about how to develop more trade and business growth in Poland. 

Main objective: The improvement of the trade relations between Dutch and Polish entrepreneurs in the market for cut flowers and flower bulbs. 

Give Polish entrepreneurs more consumer insights to change their marketing mix were needed. 

Initiator; Dutch Embassy in Warsaw 

Book Publication: Flourishing Trade – A market and culture scan of the Polish flowers and flower bulbs market. 

Responsibilities: Overall management, Sales, Marketing, Market research, organization and contact person for Polish counterparts.

contributors.headline: Key Account Manager at DB Schenker

projects.title: Organisation seminar "Flourishing Trade IE/NL 2013", Dublin, Ireland
projects.description: A trade seminar where we aimed to stimulate business relations between Irish and Dutch companies in the horticultural amenity sector. During the seminar a unique research, conducted by the Amsterdam University of Applied Sciences into the horticulture sector in Ireland, was presented alongside a cultural market scan. The day ended with an opportunity to network with professionals in the horticulture field. The research presented will be published in a book to be published later in 2013.

profile_positions.company: Cello Square by Samsung SDS Global
profile_positions.description:
As a Business Development Manager I am responsible for growing the market share by
acquiring, maintaining and developing profitable business from prospects. Samsung SDS is
starting to gain new business and profiling itself as a new player on the logistics market. 

In Samsung SDS Smart Logistics we provide innovative services by developing and applying
optimized logistics solutions. We provide integrated logistics and information services based on
our own platform and we provide SCM/Logistics consultancy to our customers. We offer entire
logistics process management, including execution, consulting and optimizing. In Europe our
main customer is Samsung Electronics with whom we collaborate together with more than 15
Samsung European subsidiaries in order to optimize their European Supply Chain strategy for
all electronics products

profile_positions.description:

Hunting for large enterprise accounts Airfreight Benelux
Develop existing large size key accounts within Benelux area (Key Account Management)
Achieve set targets on new and existing accounts.
Collect market information , develop sales strategy and sales target
Reporting to customer, managing MBR’s/ QBR’s to satisfaction of customers
Take care of RFQ processes being the commercial contact in the process for customers followed by implementation
Building and maintaining relationships, farming after hunting
profile_positions.title: Business Development Manager Benelux

profile_positions.description:
With more than 2,000 locations in some 140 countries, DB Schenker Logistics connects all the major economic regions with each other. In the Netherlands alone, we operate a network of 22 logistics centers and offices at 18 locations. DB Schenker Logistics can draw on a history of more than 140 years and has been operating in the Netherlands since 1892. DB Schenker Logistics has been an autonomous transport and logistics division of Deutsche Bahn since 2002.

-	I lead the pricing/procurement team/department at the business unit airfreight of DB  Schenker Logistics Netherlands. 
-	I supervise, instruct, correct and encourage employees and ensure good cooperation
-	I look after and enforce all pricing related activities including tender management, airline negotiations, monthly, quarterly and annual reporting
-	I give guidance to the members of the team (team consist of 5 team members)
-	I oversee the quality of the operation and act as a contact point
-	I make recommendations to the management regarding working methods, tools and organization of work
-	I take care of proper communication with other team leaders and execution of work
-	Relationship management of customers, key accounts and expanding new business
profile_positions.title: Team Leader Pricing Desk
Inside Sales Executive

profile_positions.description:
Air Cargo Trader is a General Sales Agent who is representing airlines cargo divisions. Our largest customer was Emirates SkyCargo and my main job was to take care of inside sales and all administrative tasks involved for the Emirates SkyCargo operation. Worked in a dedicated team with whom I processed customers requests and reservations on a daily basis. 
I was also involved in inside and field sales which includes handling rate requests received through e-mail or telephone to sell the Emirates SkyCargo product and attract as much business as possible. Working closely with our stations all around the world and communicating closely with head-quarters in Dubai. 
In addition to this I was also involved with almost all other tasks in the company, for example supervision of aircraft loading at aircraft side. Ramp supervision is done on a daily basis at Freighters and Pax flights. Boeing 777-200, 777-300 777 Freighter an 747 Freighter. .
